page.title: 01THE HIGH CROSS AREA.
page.content: The area around High Cross is predominantly rural. Apart from{"HIGH {CROSS VILLAGE"}itself,there are only a few small and scattered hamlets. These include;{"BAKERS END"}which is no more than a few large farm houses around a duck pond;{"BABBS GREEN"}which is now a modern housing estate connected to Wareside; and{"COLD CHRISTMAS"}which has a row of farming cottages. Farming is the main activity of the area. The landscape is beautiful and despite being so near London,it remains remote and unspoilt. The area is divided by the{"RIVER RIB"}which is a tributary of the River Lee. Along its banks and in the local woodland,wildlife is abundant. A well used network of public footpaths cross the area. The only area of sizable population is High Cross village,along the A.10 London to Cambridge road.
